medical_history.chief_complaint: Extensive burns and possible trampling after a nightclub fire.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The burns occurred during a pyrotechnics display at a nightclub. Symptoms included confusion and agitation at the scene, followed by disorientation, moderate distress, coughing up soot, and difficulty breathing upon arrival at the emergency department 90 minutes later. The patient sustained second- and third-degree burns involving 30 to 60 percent of body surface area and had carbonaceous material in the airways.
medical_history.social_history: The patient does not smoke and occasionally drinks alcohol; she is divorced and has two children.
